website_summaries.verdict: An economical footrest that can help you improve your posture and circulation.
pros: Supports the legs at your preferred tilt angle
Flat design guarantees the footrest is easy to store in a home or office
Adjustable angles make the footrest an ideal choice for all users, regardless of height
Rigid edges allow your feet to grip onto the footrest without slipping off
cons: Won't necessarily stay in place consistently on a wood floor
Footrest may rock back and forth at times

customer_reviews.title: but it wasn't like I was standing on it
customer_reviews.text: This broke 3 weeks after I bought it. I should have returned it immediately, but I didn't..and now I'm past the return date. It seemed to work ok--maybe mine was defective..hard to tell. It's not very strong, but it wasn't like I was standing on it.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie garcia

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable Tilt Doesn't Lock In Place
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this has adjustable heights but I didn't understand the adjustable tilt doesn't "lock into place" as other reviewers point out. I don't like this weird teeter-totter effect but I didn't want to package it up and pay return shipping so I'll continue using it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Hourglass Cat

customer_reviews.title: I liked it, it felt comfortable and the price was ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in September. I liked it, it felt comfortable and the price was right. Fast forward to today, five months later, both of the sides where the height adjustment locks in have now broken (cheap plastic). The last one broke today and when it broke (with my feet on it) it slammed down and broke the foot adjustment piece off the front (also cheap plastic). I guess you get what you pay for, right? I will now look for something a little more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last - broke after a couple of months.
customer_reviews.text: While it seemed great at first, it broke quickly. It keeps my feet up off the floor a bit but really, it's useless since it is no longer adjustable. Its not like I was standing on it either - it broke when I knocked it with my chair.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Who knew this would help so much?
customer_reviews.text: I recently slipped two discs in my lower back and have since tried to optimize my desk working arrangement to the best of my ability, and on the cheap. This helped SO much. It keeps my knees at a 90 degree angle, which is good for your back but often impossible if your desk and chair both are not adjustable. I highly recommend one of these regardless of whether or not you already have back problems. Save yourself the trouble and prevent them.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: I loved this foot rest
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I loved this foot rest. It really helped with circulation (as I sit at a desk for long hours at work). In just over a month, some of the plastic rods that hold the platform up have now broken and the product is useless. I am hoping the seller will replace this or refund this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Miller

customer_reviews.title: It's a no-brainer at this price!
customer_reviews.text: Just took it out of the box, placed it on floor under the desk, raised to highest level and got after it. Was glad I made the purchase within 30 seconds of use. No matter what position i've got my chair in, or my own posture (slouched or straight back), it feels more ergo with my feet on this thing. Well done Mind Reader!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Szynal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome if you don't need a super high footrest and don't mind that it rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I rather like this thing even though it totally reminds me of every office I've ever worked in. I didn't know it did the rocking thing until after I ordered it but surprisingly I think that's kind of a cool feature actually. Can't believe it only cost $11 with shipping and tax I always thought they cost a lot more. The only think I don't like is that I didn't get one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I am in bad health and needed a foot and leg device to get thru the night. At my age I know you get what you pay for! I tried to get a deal $$$$ and I got a grade A piece of frick’in junk. It broke on day 2. Terrible design and cheap parts. I tried to fix it and then took it to HOA Maintenance to see what they could do. My HOA employee buddy and former paratrooper just laughed. I threw it away in frustration! I should have my head examined. You should if you buy this after reading this review!
customer_reviews.author: Clifton T. Azok

customer_reviews.title: Plastic broke after 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The product overall wasn't bad. A little on the cheap side but it worked just fine for the fist few weeks. The 5th week in I was sitting down, put my feet up and heard a loud snap and found two pieces of plastic broke off. Unfortunately it's just outside of the return window. Attempting to reach out to Amazon to see if I can get in touch with the manufacturer to get it replaced or refunded.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I would like the fact that it adjusts. And I do like that fact. But I wish it had a way to lock out once you get it set where you want, but it rocks back and forth like a teeter totter. Won't lock into place. Even if it had a little resistance to the rocking it might be tolerable. But it rocks and flexes too much. I really don't think it will hold up to long term use.
customer_reviews.author: J Baccus

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable, Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: You can adjust this and it is sturdy to where it feels it wouldn’t break anytime soon. Adjusting is relatively easy, however if you have to adjust it in a small place it may be difficult. The only thing as to why I wouldn’t give it a 5 star is there’s only two heights you can choose from, nothing in between.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda Zanotti

customer_reviews.title: Received returned item that is broken
customer_reviews.text: Received a returned item, as soon as I saw the tape on the box noticed it had been returned, and it sounded like maracas inside, when I opened it and pulled it out there were broken pieces at the bottom and upon inspection found where those had come off and the hinge was lose to the side.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I started an office job about 3 months ago. Prior to that I worked in a restaurant for many years and was used to being on my feet all day. It's ben a rough transition but purchasing this has been great for me. It definitely helps with circulation and the bumps on the top are like a mini foot massager. I love the fact that the top part can move and adjust as I see fit. This is only my second day using it but I am very satisfied. The only improvement that would make it better for me would be if the top had a gel like consistency instead of being completely plastic
customer_reviews.author: FaithG10

customer_reviews.title: Probably not
customer_reviews.text: So, first off, it's too narrow of a foot rest. It might be acceptable for a female, as there's nothing in between the legs that get in the way of putting your feet on this, but otherwise...yeah. Also, really not sure what they were thinking with the plastic bubble sort of deal. Maybe it's for grip? But all it does is create concentrated points of pressure on your feet. Why is this highly rated? I think I chose this over other foot rests because it was cheaper, and I thought adjustability would be a big deal. I admit, it is... but the base product being adjusted has to actually be comfortable to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short friends, beware, it’s not so short-friendly.
customer_reviews.text: I’m still unsure about this. I think I wish it were a little “stiffer”. I don’t need that much “see-saw” in it. And also, the part where you put your foot on it to move it (I guess that’s what’s its for) sticks straight out and gets in the way of my chair legs (5 wheels, 5 swivel casters, 1 swivel chair base—hard to control it from hitting that thing). I’m short, I need a foot stool, and this is good, just not what I think I need. Do you have a
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Best thing EVER. Until it broke a few months later. 😠
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: It's not a bad product but...
customer_reviews.text: So this product is pretty well made for the price. A very sturdy plastic. I do have to caveat though that the top plate is free floating and doesn't lock. This is the downside to my eyes. I wanted something that can do all the different angles but actually lock in place. I prefer something that locks in place because I tend to push off of this. I ended buying another option which was more like a solid piece of wood with grip tape on it. It costed a little more but held its ground and doesn't budge because of it's weight and design.
customer_reviews.author: Large Lau

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a game-changer. I love that it is solid in construction, has adjustable heights, and is capable of a slight rocking motion. It keeps my legs elevated comfortably at my desk and allows me to move and stretch and keep my feet busy throughout the day. I had looked into a foot hammock but am so glad I went this route instead. The only slight con is that the base juts out just a bit in the front and sometimes it prevents my office chair from sliding all the way under the desk. A quick adjustment to the base wheels of my office chair and it is no problem at all!
customer_reviews.author: Kiley

customer_reviews.title: Does not Last
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not durable at all. It only worked as advertised for under three months. I've had to fix it multiple times since then. Even when it was still usable, it was difficult to adjust the height consistently without literally going down and adjusting with my hands. On multiple occasions (at least twice a week), the rubber circles at the bottom holding the whole thing together kept popping out so I had to fix it. Eventually, the rubber things broke down and I had to find makeshift replacements. But I'm sick of it. Don't buy it if you plan on using it for a long time and you want something that doesn't require constant maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: BROKE
customer_reviews.text: So we purchased this product to appease a worker on March 1, 2019. I spoke to Amazon and they told me to go through the manufacturer. The number to them is 1-855-629-6784, called several time but apparently they need to delete some messages since it was full all day. So I emailed them at cs@mindreaderproducts.com and still waiting on there response. The short story is its falling apart in less than 7 months. Now Im purchasing a different product because this one does not last. So I emailed them on the 19th and today being the 23rd no response. So now again have to contact Amazon. I will say Amazon is great, but on warranty issues not so great.
customer_reviews.author: Terry K

customer_reviews.title: Good While It Lasted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October 2019. It's been under my desk ever since but I don't always put my feet on it. It is now mid-July 2020. It no longer remains elevated because part of it broke. (Most of the footrest is plastic but honest--I did not use it in any off-label way.) The broken piece is the side of the part imprinted with the instructions "To raise, Grasp both sides and lift." Without raising it, the top of the footrest is 3 inches off the floor, so that's something at least.
customer_reviews.author: SAN People

customer_reviews.title: bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with some back pain I've been experiencing while working at my desk. I am not sure if it is working yet or not but it is comfortable. It also forces me to sit in a better way. The only thing is that it is pretty big. I was thinking it would be smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I sit at my desk a lot and due to my height and age, my feet swell A LOT! I bought this to elevate my feet and to prevent the swelling. Mission accomplished! Is it cheap plastic? Yes, but I don’t mess with the adjustments like other reviewers so it’s not a problem for me. My only concern is that I am in my home office and I love bare feet, so the bumps tend to be uncomfortable for me a lot, but that’s a personal problem. So if I don’t like it, wear shoes, duh! Lol Otherwise, great product for the money and serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Maria H.

customer_reviews.title: All the features
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has a hard time sitting still but works at a desk all day, this lovely foot rest has saved my sanity and body posture. With adjustable height and tilting action it keeps even my busy feet entertained. The bumps are great for when I sneakily take my shoes off and use it to massage my feet. No one has noticed me doing this, except for the occasional sigh of happiness coming from my desk. It's build solid and held up to my tapping, rocking, adjusting all the time, and being kicked around. Keep your feet happy and get yourself one!
customer_reviews.author: NoStop

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on 2/28/2018 and on 4/4/2018 it has already broken from regular use. This isn't even something that I took to work to use 8 hours a day 5 days a week, it was used at my home computer and only used by me (live alone). The foot rest is quite comfortable, and the texture of the surface doesn't feel bad on my feet when I'm in socks or barefoot. For $15 at the time of writing, it's a better product that I expected in terms of comfort and usability, but loses 3 stars for durability. I'll do my best to duct tape and super glue it up and keep using it since the return window is passed.
customer_reviews.author: Thoraxe

customer_reviews.title: Not really what I was expecting. Does't lift up ...
customer_reviews.text: Not really what I was expecting. Does't lift up very far. Moves around way too much. Falls down too easily
customer_reviews.author: RStallings

customer_reviews.title: Slides all over the floor
customer_reviews.text: I may need to apply velcro or something. It slides all over the floor and I have to crawl under my desk and move it to where I want it and then do it all over again an hour later. I like that it goes back and forth so that you can pretend it is almost a gas pedal - I dont use that feature all the time, but it is nice. Some of my shoes wont grip the bumps and they slide right off them so what is the point? It stands to be improved. It is just ok
customer_reviews.author: Amber G.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help with leg and knee pain from sitting long hours at my desk. Seemed to work as advertised for about a month and a half, then it broke. One of the pins that allowed the product to keep its height broke. Since it broke outside of the return window I cant return the product and there is no information on warranty repairs. No one from the company will respond to emails or any messages regarding customer service. Avoid this product at all costs, it wont hold up to even the basic wear and tear of daily use. Save your money and go for a unit that is made from metal.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Didn't realize I needed this
customer_reviews.text: My daughter who has a certificate in Ergonomics from work, suggested I get this (after doing an overall ergo evaluation of my work space). I was pleased with the packaging and nothing to really put together. I like the pebbly surface so massage my feet on as well as the swivel of the top to stretch out my calves and tops of the feet. I find myself not crossing my legs as much which is good. Seems to be made with a sturdy plastic. I am glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: mary mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: Made all the difference!
customer_reviews.text: I have really been struggling with my desk set up since we started working from home. Didn't think this would make this big of a difference. Wish I got it a lot sooner. I set it up pretty high which allows me to set the chair high enough for my comfort and still keep my legs at a great level to keep my feet flat. I use it flat and can rock it back and forth too. Best purchase I have made. So many options on set up and really easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Slide Adjustment Fails
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism to adjust the height and level is flimsy and slide around if the footrest is even slightly moved or jarred. Adjusting it to the remain in the place you put it is a hassle, and for someone with back issues or other type of pain would be very difficult. If you pick it up to adjust it, turn it over and so forth, it will slide out of place by the time you have it back on the ground. Since it is the main component of the footrest- it is a big problem with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maryn

customer_reviews.title: A so so stool
customer_reviews.text: Plastic. Lightweight. The bumps on the surface felt good on my feet, but the thing is not steady. It tilts back and forth and I couldn't figure out how or if I could get it to stabalize. I returned it for a wooden stool that I like much better.
customer_reviews.author: L. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Broken after two months. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality, broke in a little over two months. I’ve never written a review before on Amazon, but I feel like I have to do it after the stand broke after only two months of normal use. I put it under my desk in my office to rest my feet while I’m sitting. However, the stand broke after too quick too early. I was surprised to see how poor the quality was given its price. Definitely won’t recommend buy this to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaihua

customer_reviews.title: True comfort
customer_reviews.text: My legs are happy now. I spend at least three hours straight in front of my desk, so my legs were giving me a hard time. Now I am relief from the pain. I have to confess that I pair this item with a seat cushion. Since the footrest moves up and down, I can even use that feature to move my legs. This item doesn't substitute a good walk or getting up to stretch your legs, but if you have a lot to work to do in front of the computer It sure gives you more comfort
customer_reviews.author: Jorge F. Reyes-Spindola

customer_reviews.title: No more sore legs while sitting- This was the fix!
customer_reviews.text: I kept wondering why my lower legs were bothering me while working from home. That's when I realized I needed to be more economical while sitting- like I would if I was in the office. I purchased this and it really added comfort and instant pain relief in my sitting for long periods of time. BEST INVESTMENT!!
customer_reviews.author: BeAmazing2

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken.
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived broken. One of the round ends that rests on the floor to stabilize the unit was snapped off. The package arrived with some damage to the corner of the box. The unit also slides or creeps on my hardwood floor. The broken part surely doesn't help this issue but I think the units would creep nonetheless. The rubber pods underneath simply don't grab. The missing part made the unit float or wobble from left to right. I asked for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy and comfortable under-desk footrest
customer_reviews.text: My doctor likes me to keep my feet up as much as possible, even when I'm on the computer- as I am most of my waking time! This footrest works well for that. I like that it's got some pivoting in it, so I can adjust my feet to take pressure off my knees, and to move my feet to use various leg muscles. The angle of the surface, and its bumpy texture, make it easier for me to keep my feet on it. It is compact, and fits easily in my space. I am glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: CissaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and spend long hours at the computer. I started having problems with ankle swelling. Not any more with this!! I kept the plastic bag on the item to keep it very clean since I have it on the floor under my desk. The foam is nice and thick and so comfortable. Don't hesitate to purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: DDF

customer_reviews.title: Just hit the buy button
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this purchase. It is comfortable, affordable and exactly what I was looking for. It supports your feet, has different levels for your comfort and fits well under any desk. Just buy it already. You're wasting time reading these reviews ;)
customer_reviews.author: VanDzne

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Decent
customer_reviews.text: I've had my old plastic foot rest for years and parts of the bottom broke off several months ago. I think I bought it at Office Depot or Office Max. I was glad to buy a new one and the one that arrived today is different than my old one. Better built. The only thing I don't like about it are the large raised 'bumps' on the surface. It's okay when wearing house slippers but kind of painful barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great little stool
customer_reviews.text: I like the different elevations of the stool and the fact that it does not slide around. I find myself taking off my shoes and massaging my feet while sitting at the computer for so long.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 and a half months
customer_reviews.text: I was quite pleased with the comfort and the ability to easily adjust it (though sometimes it was a bit difficult to exactly get it to do what I wanted, I generally could get it right with a bit of effort.) It's comfortable, even barefoot. However, mine broke after 3 and a half months of use. Only two of the four major pivots are metal, the two side connections are glued plastic - one of which broke. Might be fine if you don't use it daily, but I'd look for something without a break point.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Goehring

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended Overall
customer_reviews.text: This is actually better than I expected because I did not realize that it swivels. I absolutely love it. The only reason I didn’t give it five stars is that it slides on my tile floor and that is quite aggravating. I’m trying to find some way to anchor it and I’m sure I will so ultimately it’s not a problem but it’s something they could’ve taken care of quite easily. I do recommend it highly aside from that. It is solidly made and the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Carla R

customer_reviews.title: Great product! I type for five hours a day ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I type for five hours a day and this baby has made my time at the computer much more comfortable! It's thick, heavy duty plastic, very sturdy, and exactly as described. It's helped relieve my back and knee pain just in a few short days. I'm so glad I splurged at purchased this! I also enjoy the little "nubbies" on my feet when going sans shoes. It's kind of like a tiny foot massage! Oh, also, shipping was fast and the item came in original packaging! LOVE IT! Would purchase it again!
customer_reviews.author: SC Native Mom

customer_reviews.title: No more pain
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this one I had bought two other foot rests while I work at the computer. I was starting to get lower back pain because my feet hang off my chair but when I got this done I finally got some relief. Also the little round balls massage your feet if you are wearing cold or barefoot. I bought this for working from home
customer_reviews.author: E.R.

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly made. Broke in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: This product was great while it lasted! It’s made out of extremely cheap plastic which is fine for the majority of parts but why make the hinge and hold out of cheap plastic? I used in under my desk and barely leaned on it while adjusting in my chair and it snapped within a month of use. Completely unusable now. I don’t even want a free new one because I’m sure it will just happen shortly after. Seriously though, plastic hinges? Pretty bad.
customer_reviews.author: Brian F

customer_reviews.title: It is a foot stool
customer_reviews.text: This is a foot stool and it is adjustable. However, it tends to be very unstable both vertically and with regards to slipping across the floor. If your feet don't move while on the foot stool then would be okay. If directly on a rug, the slip factor might be better but if on a hard floor or chair pad, then it's always shifting. In the vertical, it doesn't lock in place so easy to knock flat and hard to get back.
customer_reviews.author: Argus

customer_reviews.title: It seems better than what some people were saying.
customer_reviews.text: Its great! I'm 5'7" woman at 130 lbs so i'm not overweight but athletically built. I had some leg pain from sitting but would reoccur when i'd take a walk and sit back down. This helps me not to put my feet on my pc tower, which I've shamefully shut off my pc multiple times doing that, and it really helps promote good and healthy sitting position. Its saying a lot from me because i usually would have my knees at my chest or my legs under me while i sat. Quality is fine, I know its not going to last 5 years but compared to the overpriced ones that have even worse reviews i'll take this one any day!
customer_reviews.author: Anna S.

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A GAME CHANGER
customer_reviews.text: I have a very sedentary job. My feet swell by the end of the day and my back aches. Now that I have this little beauty under my desk, I am amazed at how much more comfortable I am. My back hasn't been hurting as much. I purchased another one for at home too. I also really enjoy that it has the raised texture so you can rub your feet against it for nerve stimulation and that it swivels front and back to keep the feet moving. GREAT INVENTION!
customer_reviews.author: Tari

customer_reviews.title: Easily Broken - Would Not Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: This foot rest has great intentions but is shoddy and flimsy - ordered two and both broke within the first 60 days of use. What they may not tell you is that if you apply much pressure (using your feet as leverage to adjust your seating) it will bust pieces within the footrest. That is how each ended up broken - I'm a pretty average guy, so it wasn't like I was trying to adjust 500lbs of weight here. I would suggest looking for foam footrests or at least better-made footrests. Do not buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Troy D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my restless feet when they dont exactly feel supported
customer_reviews.text: I have this weird thing when i am at my desk where my feet have to be pushing on something or more like resting on something instead of being flat on the ground. It takes away that anxiety feeling away and its comfy to use without shoes because of the bumps on it, it kind of feels like a massage.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan P.

customer_reviews.title: Great adjustable foot rest
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Have very similar one at work by another brand, which does not seem to be around any more. Arrived today and I was WFH so immediately put to use. I am 5’1” so got to have a foot rest to take the strain off. Love that you can gently rock your feet forward and back while resting on it. I use it set on the bottom height as my keyboard is already at 25”. Low enough.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl S

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I am not in love with this thing or happy with it. It is cheap and very unstable. I had to stop using mine because I spent way too much effort trying to keep my feet balanced in this thing so it wouldn’t flip to the side, which mine did twice. I do not like it at all. I would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jesilyn83

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Felt great on the feet. Just a tad too high for my particular needs
customer_reviews.text: This produce is excellent. The pad felt SO soft and comfy, yet firm enough to support the feet. My sister had it and i loved it. Unfortunately the height of the pillow was just a bit too high for my particular desk/chair combination (chair is low), but I think anyone with a standard office type desk and chair would be find it works for them. Yes, I would recommend it even though it did not work out for me and I will need to return.
customer_reviews.author: msmeza@hotmail.com

customer_reviews.title: Have to reset constantly
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side, you can keep your feet elevated and straight out, most of the time. I do like that it teeters to accomodate my ankles. Unfortunately, you cannot move it around or you lose your height setting. It's annoying that it doesn't lock into place. I think that an old pc on its side would do the trick too.
customer_reviews.author: ZS

customer_reviews.title: Glad I ditched my makeshift box for the real thing!
customer_reviews.text: The desk in my apartment is built in and a little too tall. In order to be ergonomic, I needed to raise my chair but then wasn’t able to touch the ground. After months of using a makeshift box, I decided to bite the bullet and purchase this and am glad I did! I chose this one because I could adjust the height. I also like that I can stretch my legs and it tilts the other way. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Phoebs

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy footrest
customer_reviews.text: As someone who sits behind a computer for more than 8 hours a day, I wanted to get a footrest for better posture. The footrest is sturdy and great as a tool that helps with posture. However one thing I did not like about the footrest is that, there was no locking mechanism that locks the footrest in place. It wiggles and swirls as you put your feet on it. It was uncomfortable at first but your body gets used to it real fast.
customer_reviews.author: Tergel

customer_reviews.title: Not terrible but I would go with something else
customer_reviews.text: I've had it around a month and I expected a softer squishier foot rest based on the appearance but it's actually a hard plastic. The base also twists a bit if you don't have you weight distributed properly so I could see long term issues with it holding up. Will update in the future if it has issues.
customer_reviews.author: Blw_meals

customer_reviews.title: Bot horrible but needs anti skid
customer_reviews.text: Still on the fence about this one. Difficult to find the right position for comfort and the rise would randomly change positions. I also need to wear shoes (which I hate) because the number s are not that comfortable. Not worth the effort to send back so I will make it work
customer_reviews.author: A. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Seemed reliable, but broke under large (350lb) person use in under 6 months
customer_reviews.text: As a man that is over 350 lbs (150 KG) the mostly plastic design of this product is lacking in strength. I have owned this product for less than six months and it's already broken beyond use. I'm aware that I probably used this product improperly, but I feel like it's worth putting out into the ether that this product is not meant for heavier folk. I reiterate that this foot rest is made of almost exclusively plastic. The few meta parts are the rod that fit into the "height/angle slots" and whatever is used for the hinges to connect the plastic parts together.
customer_reviews.author: Zurodine

customer_reviews.title: Small design fluke
customer_reviews.text: My only complain with this product is that the four rubber stoppers at the bottom do not hold the foot rest in place, if you have tile floors or a very flat surface other than carpet, when you rest your feet the weight will slowly push it away from you, having you to adjust position ever time.
customer_reviews.author: OJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Sturdy, with adjustable position. Well made, it’s strong not flimsy. I tried it barefoot, I have it in my home office. You can feel the spheres massing the bottom of your feet like acupressure. I would definitely recommend. It’s not good to have your feet hanging.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Seriously?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and was advertised a NEW product. I didn’t choose a used or open box product. It’s clearly been used and returned and has visible wear and tear. I mean come on, replacing the old box that’s torn to bits and is being held together by a slither of tape would have been a nice touch but you can see what came out of my amazon package... is a new box too expensive or time consuming to make?? Nicely done (sarcasm..) this was very disappointing. Now all i can think about is the smelly disgusting possibly covid infested feet that used this thing before it got to my house!!
customer_reviews.author: Can Ozkaya

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This foot rest is just that, a foot rest. It's a little creaky and rocks back and forth, which is not a good thing. Its not as nice as the one I have at the office which is totally still, but its better than using a cardboard box. I'd recommend going for a more solid option if you have the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Arrived without key components
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived looking like it had travelled through hell to reach me. I suspect someone else had already returned it first given the condition. Completely unuseable, the bar that would allow it to be adjustable was....missing. So without that this footrest is completely useless. Check the seller reviews before purchasing this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Pegamoose

customer_reviews.title: Not cushion, not stable.
customer_reviews.text: After use it for a while it hurt my feet, it doesn't have any cushion so it feels very hard on your feet. Also, it doesn't have a way to fix the position, so it is loose, what can be usefull when you want to do movements to relax your ankle but it should have an option to fix it, so you can put you feet and get the support you need. Instead, I keep put it my feet and loosing the posture.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Item came as it looks, great product, you wont be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: this is great for my little self. that way I can sit at my desk comfortably great product, sturdy it does not lock into place, so if you move your feet it will move with you if you need it to stay stable I suppose you could place something under the other side or against the wall but I dont do that and it still works for me but its not a bad thing, so dont let that discourage you its still a great product
customer_reviews.author: Hapa

customer_reviews.title: Life-changing product I will bring to any desk I sit at
customer_reviews.text: I will never sit at a desk again without this. This is a great design and an amazing product for the price. I regret not having it years ago. What a life changer I no longer have sore feet at the end of the day from sitting . It sounds silly but if you have problem legs or feet you know what I mean
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: feels cheap like it will break soon. dont like the locking mechanism as it will move to other heights if you move the wrong way. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Powell

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This footrest was super comfortable for the 9 weeks it lasted. I loved it and used it every day M-F at work. I literally have another one sitting in my cart to purchase for my home computer—I liked it that much. Then today out of nowhere *SNAP*. Super bummed!!! :(
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Helps but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for about a month now and I like that it rocks with my feet because I am a person who does not sit still. However, it falls and does not stay at the right height. The first day out of the box my son tired putting his feet on it and we heard a snap of plastic, could not see any damage but certainly heard it. Perhaps that is why it will not stay at the height I want it to stay. I would not purchase this brand again but I will keep it and use it because to much of a hassle to return.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick if you just want to rest your feet while working or if you want to move your feet. As the others state, the unit does move away from you a bit if you angle it towards you. But this is easily overcome. Worth having. Easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: SaltyDog

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: The product says specifically don't stand on it, and I understand why, it's plastic. But they should also add, don't push your rolling chair away from your desk with you feet because that is just enough pressure break it too. It should be more sturdy. And of course there is not an option to return it. Don't buy it. Find another brand that looks more sturdy. It will be worth the money. This was junk.
customer_reviews.author: M Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Relieves my pain
customer_reviews.text: It would be great if they went a little higher the plastic has no gift to you it be nice if there was a question I found some but they were much more expensive they are helping me for sure get the back of my legs off of my sciatic nerve and relieves my pain
customer_reviews.author: StarServices LLC

customer_reviews.title: Foot rest 3 height
customer_reviews.text: I like this foot rest because height can be adjusted. I can rock it back and forth. Something I don't like about this foot rest: When I rock it back and forth, it makes sound due to friction which is annoying. Overall, it is ok to buy.
customer_reviews.author: SJ2020

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Eh. This foot rest is lacking. It’s adjustable but just doesn’t do what I need. I have lower back issues and need a sturdy foot rest. It’s not very sturdy and doesn’t lock in place. I kept it too long to return but I should have. Not what I needed and it is flimsy. Look around for something better. I’m using a cardboard box. It works better
customer_reviews.author: rhonda m.

customer_reviews.title: I need it now...
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed it being movable so I can "rock it" back n forth while stressing out at my desk. I like to rub my socked feet over the bumps, it's soothing. This is an affordable and wonderful purchase for my new remote work spot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Durability Was Lacking
customer_reviews.text: I like the footrest at first although it did take some time to get used to the bumps. However after a little after a month the legs of the foot rest started to come unattached which is rather easily fixed however it happens often by just using the foot rest and is rather annoying to have to keep fixing. The foot rest also will not lock in place which means it rocks back and forth underneath your feet with the slightest shift.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Samaniego

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Good but I don’t like how it rocks back and forth! My son has adhd and the rocking option is something he likes but I’d like to see an option to create a lock position. Other than that, it’s fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Recording Artist, Author, Wife, Mom, and Friend

customer_reviews.title: Completely free swivel means it provides no support
customer_reviews.text: The "angled" nature of this is a very lose swivel which means that you can't actually rest your feet on this. Instead, your feet need to apply angled pressure to the "rest" to keep at a particular angle. I found that this hurt my knees immediately.
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: It serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I have it under my office desk. I really like it. I like that it's movable since I'm fidgety. But it slides back. I wish it has an anti-slip on the bottoms for it to stay in place until I move it. Also the height adjustment can't be locked in place. Throughout the day, it gets lower on me, I might have to glue it to keep it same all day.
customer_reviews.author: Bébé

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: This foot rest didn't scratch my floor like the other one but it's just too bulky and I have a lot of leg room under my desk. I moved it to a desk with less leg room and it's just impossible to use it. Not really any grip for your feet either. I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D'Auria

customer_reviews.title: Works so Good I Bought Two!
customer_reviews.text: I use this under my desk when I game, it's awesome for helping me to not slouch, and for keeping my back from hurting after sitting for a short time, I don't really ever have to manually adjust it unless I want it higher or lower, because it smart adjusts. That's why they called it the Mind Reader. It's so great I even gave my first one to a friend, and bought a second one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Valynn

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: It's a hunk of plastic to rest your feet on. At best it made me slightly more comfortable, but because the tilt doesn't stay in place, it's more distracting than anything else. A stack of a few books would do a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but I wouldn't buy this model again.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job but it's wobbly. The brace is in the middle so when resting your feet on either side the foot rest can be wobbly. I'll keep it but when it breaks I won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's convenient and you can take it with you places but I did dislike the like bumps on the rest, due to if you use it and you habe no shoes on it does make your feet sore. But it is a goos product other wise.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need
customer_reviews.text: I am short and it is impossible to adjust my chair to a height where I can plant my feet on the floor and comfortable use my keyboard. This foot rest is just the right height, adjustable, and easy to move with me.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn S

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because of my height. I'm 4'11 and have issues often with desk to floor height. This foot rest allows me to rest my feet comfortably enough so I do not develop numbing in the legs. You can adjust the foot rest to lean closer to the floor or higher up. I'm definitely happy with this purchase and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa J. Holt

customer_reviews.title: doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Didn't make it past the 3 month mark. Snapped in basically the exact same place where other reviewers posted pictures of it breaking. UPDATE: Tried contacting the company about the warranty multiple times. They never responded.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 3 months use.
customer_reviews.text: This product felt unstable from the start so I shouldn't be surprised that it ended up broken from light moderate regular use like so many other purchasers have stated. It appears to be in exactly the same spot and exactly the same pieces that I have seen broken and other's reviews. Search around a little more for something that is proper sturdy or you could get super glue all over your hands like me trying to fix this thing now. Unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this footrest for work. I had to raise my office chair in order for my wrists to be straight while typing but I am short. I have been happy with this footrest. I like that the pitch and angle are adjustable. I feel comfortable when I have to sit for longer periods of time. It also feels sturdy and longlasting.
customer_reviews.author: Holden

customer_reviews.title: Slides around a lot, otherwise, does what it should
customer_reviews.text: The reviewers that said it slides around were right. I would invest in some better rubber or velcro to stick it to the floor. Otherwise, easily adjustable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JB123

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My desk and chair at work were too high and my feet would dangle. Since this product lifts, it work great. And I like that I can rock my feet back and forth. Helps me to stay focused.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable and has helped me greatly since having to work from home during covid-19. It took a bit adjusting my home office to be ergonomic friendly! This did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: sones

customer_reviews.title: Very good and useful
customer_reviews.text: The only improvement I can ask for is that to be heavier to be fix on the ground and a bit wider to easily fit both feet. But overall it changed my life and now I really have a better posture at work which is good for my neck and back.
customer_reviews.author: Maziar Aboualizadehbehbahani

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable heights!
customer_reviews.text: I have been having cramps in my legs from work. I started using this foot rest and in one day I already noticed a difference. I like the adjustable heights and that it gives different angles for you to stretch out your feet. Highly recommend. I actually told my co-workers about it and let them try it. Impressed with how easily you can use it.
customer_reviews.author: New Scent

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low bak support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help support my low back while I sit at my desk. It has really helped. I thought it would be difficult to get used to but surprisingly it seemed really natural (probably because it really helped to support my low back). I use it every day at work. It doesn't move on the floor (very low pile carpet).
customer_reviews.author: Heather C.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Very Easily.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought two of these because at first, I loved them. One for the office, one for home. They BOTH broke within 2 months of use. If you ever accidentally put too much pressure on it, the plastic part that allows this to be adjustable snaps, therefore making this unable to change the position from the lowest/flattest setting. Would not recommend, look into something with a better design, considering how much it will be used.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Gligor

customer_reviews.title: Mind Reader Comfy Rest, Ergonomic Foot, Pressure Relief for Comfort, Back, and Body
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife but, since this C-19 issue, it's been left in her office as she's working from home now. She did use it and enjoyed it though.
customer_reviews.author: Q!

product_meta.title: Mind Reader Comfy Rest, Ergonomic Foot, Pressure Relief for Comfort, Back, and Body, 3 Height, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Size:Foot Rest 3 HeightYou'll wish you had treated yourself to a Mind Reader Leg-Lifting Footrests, Back Supports for your office Chair, Padded Arm Rests, Posture Supports and Foot Health Items a long time ago once you add them to your daily health promoting regiment at work and at home. ERGONOMIC ADJUSTABLE ANGLED TEXTURED FOOT REST: Improve leg circulation with the Mind Reader adjustable massage surface device that lifts and angles your legs, feet, knees and ankles to a position that reduces stress on the body - improve back and neck pain while you sit at work or at home - slight swivel adds flexibility while you sit or massage feet. INCREASE LEG & BACK COMFORT WHILE SITTING: Proper posture and sitting position are key to overall comfort - making sure your legs and feet are positioned comfortably while you work or while sitting at home allows you to maintain overall comfort throughout the day - when you sit with correct posture you help your neck, back, feet overall comfort and wellness. ONE FOR HOME AND ONE FOR OFFICE: Get two footrests to ensure you are comfortable at home, at work or away at college - look for simple inexpensive ways to reduce pain created by sitting for long periods of time by creating your most optimal sitting posture - don't neglect your back, neck and feet at home or work - make sure your create a comfortable environment anywhere you sit for extended periods of time. FOOT MASSAGE PEBBLED SURFACE with SWIVEL: Specially designed raised rounded pebbled textured surface is perfect for instant bottom foot massage - remove shoes and gently slide bottoms of your feed across the textured surface for satisfying relief and foot stimulation while at work or at home while sitting in your favorite chair - easy and safe glide with socks on is recommended. SPECIFICATIONS: No assembly needed adjustable foot rest swivel foot massager leg lift | 5 STAR Reviews | Material: Resin Plastic | Measures 13. 4" (L) x 17" (W) x 4. 4" (H). INSTANT COMFORT FOR BACK NECK LEGS: Your sitting position is important to your overall physical health - muscles and nerves align when you sit properly including upper body posture and leg positioning - get comfortable with Mind Reader foot and leg rest. FOOT REST MAKES A GREAT GIFT: No matter the occasion, your friends, family, colleagues, teachers and siblings will appreciate that you care enough to give them this health and wellness promoting Mind Reader leg raising massaging footrest - perfect for holidays, birthdays, housewarming for his & her gift, grandma and grandpa, mom and dad, teacher's gifts and more. COMFORT RELIEF FOR ALL AGES: Start them young with proper posture and leg positioning guidance and teach healthy living and taking care of your feet which leads to overall wellness - when your legs and feet are happy the rest of your body benefits - grandparents, parents, teachers and siblings will thank you for this thoughtful gift. GREAT VALUE - BUY MORE THAN ONE: Mind Reader footrests go a long way at home or work - double your healthy benefit to make sure you have one where ever you spend long periods of time sitting - not for standing on - apply pressure gently - perfect for his and hers GIFTS- give to your bridal party as thank you gifts. STURDY DURABLE LIGHTWEIGHT CONSTRUCTION: Lightweight construction makes these easy to move from kitchen to your comfy couch to home office - give to your favorite colleague at work or boss who could benefit from this health promoting footrest leg lifting device - Stores flat easily anywhere under your desk or in a closet at home or under your bed.
